document_title: Primary essential hypertension: Causes, symptoms, treatment
subsection_content:
Essential hypertension is high blood pressure of unknown cause, also known as primary hypertension. Blood pressure is the pressure of blood against the artery walls as the heart pumps blood throughout the body. High blood pressure occurs when the force of blood is stronger than normal.
Most cases of high blood pressure are classified as essential hypertension, while other types of high blood pressure fall into the category of secondary hypertension (high blood pressure with an identifiable cause, such as injury). heart, eyes or kidneys causing high blood pressure). This high blood pressure condition can begin at any age, but is most common in middle age.
See more information about high blood pressure here.
